channel.title: photography on (´_ゝ`) the gooberverse
channel.description: Recent content in photography on (´_ゝ`) the gooberverse

item.title: today's photowalk
item.description: today i went on a walk on the grounds near my workplace and took photos. i’d like to share a few here. take a look! An Airgas liquid nitrogen tank. shot with fuji x-t50. a fleet of trucks. shot with fuji x-t50. i love trees with sky backgrounds.

item.title: going places on your own
item.description: do you ever go somewhere to eat on your own? it feels a little weird, right? we’re very used to going with at least one other person, or at least i do that a lot of the time. i recently went to mitsuwa in Arlington Heights to get some pictures on my rental Fujifilm X-T30II. “the red lanterns of tokyo shokudo, in the food court.

item.title: photowalk in the neighborhood
item.description: today, i went on a photowalk with the Fujifilm X-T30ii i rented for a week. i walked around my neighborhood and had a great time! here’s some pictures. enjoy! “taking a break." “anyone wanna do a game of pick-up?" “phew, glad i’m not out there.

item.title: the every day
item.description: when you think of everyday things, what do you think of? do you think of people? or of sounds? or of feelings? or of sights? a familiar sight is my mom’s teacup, usually found sitting on the dining table or the living room table. (and occasionally the kitchen countertop when she forgets to bring it upstairs.) my mom’s preferred mug. usually contains green tea.

item.title: pictures and photography 2
item.description: remember how last time i talked about photography i mentioned i may one day get a camera of my own? well, it happened. sanukiseimen udon, at mitsuwa arlington heights. i got a minolta x-570, a camera made in 1983 as a low-cost alternative to the x-700. it is revered for its strictly manual capabilities and its good-for-its-time functioning lightmeter.

item.title: pictures and photography
item.description: we all go on random youtube binges right? the ones where it’s a topic that you’ve briefly touched in the past, and you never got fully into but seemed interesting at the time. one of those for me is professional photography. as someone who has done a fairly minimal amount of research into the more detailed parts of the workflow of it all, f numbers, apertures, shooting speeds, lens sizes, digital and film,
